data.title: County Down
data.meta_description: Destination County Down › Places to visit ✓ Travel tips ✓ Excursion destinations ✓ incl. App ➤ Outdooractive - your travel guide!
data.text:
Welcome to County Down! This charming region in the United Kingdom is a haven for nature lovers and outdoor enthusiasts. With its diverse landscape of rolling hills, rugged coastlines, and lush forests, County Down offers endless opportunities for exploration and adventure. Whether you're into hiking, water sports, or simply enjoying the beauty of nature, there's something here for everyone.

Geographical Location

County Down is situated in Northern Ireland on the northeastern coast of the island of Ireland. It borders County Antrim to the north and west, County Armagh to the southwest, and Lough Neagh to the northwest. The county town is Downpatrick.

Local Tourist Attractions

One of the must-see attractions in County Down is Slieve Donard Resort & Spa - a luxurious hotel nestled at the foot of Slieve Donard Mountain with breathtaking views over Dundrum Bay. Another highlight is Castle Ward - an 18th-century National Trust property featuring stunning gardens and scenic walking trails.

Cultural Highlights and Events

County Down boasts a rich cultural heritage with many historic sites such as Mount Stewart House & Gardens - an elegant stately home surrounded by landscaped grounds that host various events throughout the year including music festivals and garden tours.

Culinary Specialties

The culinary scene in County Down is vibrant with plenty of local specialties to try including fresh seafood from Kilkeel Harbor, traditional Irish stew made with locally sourced ingredients like lamb or beef from nearby farms.
